Description: One inlay made of limestone and four beads in different shapes and material. A: Object made of limestone, very soft and sheds particles when touched. One side is flat and shaped ovoid with pointed ends, the opposite site has a concave depression. All sides are well smoothed. Probably an inlay or fitting of some sort. B: Roughly spherical bead made of yellow glass with a white glass filament surrounding the body. Parts of the filament is broken off. C: 2 segmented cylindrical beads made of white faience, both broken off. D: 1 disc-shaped bead made of white glazed stone.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
